change.changenote: Regulation BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 235/2019, effective May 4, 2020.

reg:regulation.reg:title: Lobbyists Registration Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 71/2018, May 1, 2018]

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this regulation, Act means the Lobbyists Registration Act.

For the purposes of paragraph (b) (i) of the definition of "in-house lobbyist" in section 1 (1) of the Act, all time spent on activities, including preparation, that are directly related to and necessary for carrying out lobbying are included within the determination of the time spent lobbying.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of paragraph (a) (i), (iv), (v), (vi) and (vii) of the definition of "lobby" in section 1 (1) of the Act and for the purposes of sections 2.1 (1) and 4 (1) (k) of the Act, the following are prescribed as Provincial entities:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: those entities that make up the government reporting entity within the meaning of the Budget Transparency and Accountability Act, except the government as reported through the consolidated revenue fund;

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of paragraph (c) (iii) of the definition of "former public office holder" in section 1 (1) of the Act and for the purposes of section 1 (3) (d) of the Act, the Provincial entities identified in the Appendix to this regulation are prescribed.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Who is a former public office holder

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of paragraph (c) (iii) of the definition of "former public office holder" in section 1 (1) of the Act, an individual is a former public office holder if the individual

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: formerly occupied the most senior or next most senior ranking executive position in a Provincial entity identified in the Appendix, or
was the chair or a vice chair of, or held the equivalent position in, the governing body of a Provincial entity identified in the Appendix.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If more than one person formerly occupied a position that is equivalent to the next most senior position referred to in subsection (1) (a), then each of those persons is deemed to have occupied the next most senior position for the purposes of this section.
A return submitted to the registrar in the manner and by the means described in section 6 of the Act is deemed to be received by the registrar

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on the date the registrar actually receives the return if

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: that date is a business day, and
the return is received at or before 5 p.m. on that date, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on the first business day after the date the registrar actually receives the return if the return is received

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: after 5 p.m. on a business day, or

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite subsection (1), if the registrar requests that corrections be made to a return submitted to the registrar,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the return is deemed not to have been received by the registrar, and

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the registrar requests that corrections be made to a return and all of the corrections are submitted to the registrar within 10 business days after the registrar makes the request, the return as corrected is deemed to be received by the registrar on the date the return, before the corrections were requested, would have been deemed under subsection (1) to have been received by the registrar if no corrections had been requested to it.

If the registrar requests that corrections be made to a return and all of the corrections are not submitted to the registrar until more than 10 business days after the registrar makes the request, the date the return as corrected is deemed to be received by the registrar is the date on which the last correction is deemed to be received by the registrar by applying subsection (1) as though that last correction was a return submitted as described in subsection (1).

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 7.2 (2) (b) of the Act, sections 2.1 (2), 2.2, 3 (1) and (3) and 4 (1) and (2) to (4) of the Act are prescribed.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Notice and service under the Act

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Any notice or other thing that, under the Act, must be given to or served on a person may be given or served by registered mail sent to the last known address of the person.

If a notice or other thing under the Act is sent by registered mail to the last known address of the person, the notice or other thing is deemed to be given to or served on the person to whom it is addressed on the 14th day after deposit with Canada Post unless the person received actual service before that day.

oasis:entry.oasis:line: A board of education or a francophone education authority, as defined in section 1 (1) of the School Act
BC Clinical and Support Services Society
British Columbia Council for International Education
British Columbia Hydro and Power Authority
British Columbia Public School Employers' Association
Community Social Services Employers' Association of British Columbia
Creston Valley Wildlife Management Authority Trust Fund
Emily Carr University of Art and Design
First Peoples' Heritage, Language and Culture Council
Forest Enhancement Society of British Columbia
Health Employers Association of British Columbia
Organized Crime Agency of British Columbia Society
Real Estate Council of British Columbia
Real Estate Foundation of British Columbia
Trades Training Consortium of British Columbia

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Lobbyists Registration Act, S.B.C. 2001, c. 42, s. 11]

change.changenote: Section 1 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 76/2010, effective April 1, 2010.

section.sectiontext: For the purposes of section 1 (3) (c) of the Lobbyists Registration Act,

paragraph.paragraphtext: a government institution is prescribed to be a "health care body" or a "local government body" as defined in Schedule 1 of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act, and
a government corporation is prescribed to be a "government corporation" as defined in section 1 of the Financial Administration Act.

change.changenote: Section 1.1 to 1.4 were enacted by BC Reg 76/2010, effective April 1, 2010.
Section 2 (1) (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 76/2010, effective April 1, 2010.

subsection.subsectiontext: A return submitted to the registrar in the manner and by the means described in section 6 of the Lobbyists Registration Act is deemed to be received by the registrar

change.changenote: Section 1.3 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 71/2018, effective May 1, 2018.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The following are prescribed as Provincial entities for the purposes of the Act:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: those entities that make up the government reporting entity within the meaning of the Budget Transparency and Accountability Act, except the government as reported through the consolidated revenue fund;

change.changenote: Section 1.4 (1) and (2) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 71/2018, effective May 1, 2018.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An individual is a former public office holder for the purposes of section 4 (1.1) (c) of the Act if the individual

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: formerly occupied the most senior or next most senior ranking executive position in a Provincial entity, or
was a member of the governing body of a Provincial entity.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If more than one person occupies a position that is equivalent to the next most senior position referred to in subsection (1) (a), then each of those persons is deemed to hold the next most senior position for the purposes of this section.

change.changenote: Section 3 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 76/2010, effective April 1, 2010.

section.sectiontext: The fees in the following Table are prescribed:

tablerow.tablecol:
To file under section 3 (1) (a),
(3) (1) (c) (i) (A), 3 (1) (c) (i) (B),
3 (1) (c) (ii) (A) or 3 (1) (c) (ii) (B) of the Act

To file under section 3 (1) (b) (i) (A),
3 (1) (b) (i) (B), 3 (1) (b) (ii) (A) or
3 (1) (b) (ii) (B) of the Act

change.changenote: Section 4 was enacted by BC Reg 76/2010, effective April 1, 2010.
Section 4 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 71/2018, effective May 1, 2018.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Provisions that can be the subject of administrative penalties
bcl:section.bcl:text: An administrative penalty may be imposed under section 7.2 (2) (b) of the Act for the contravention of any of sections 2.1 (2), 3 (1) and (3) and 4 (1) and (2) to (4).

change.changenote: Section 5 was enacted by BC Reg 76/2010, effective April 1, 2010.
Appendix was enacted by BC Reg 71/2018, effective May 1, 2018.
